page.title: 04PEOPLE IN LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Listers Factory.}Robert Ashton Lister began a small agricultural machinery firm with two employees in 1867. The business grew and became the biggest industry in the district, now making diesel engines. {Pedersens bicycles.}Mikael Pedersen came to Dursley from Denmark about 1893. He produced his Dursley Pedersen bicycle, with a hammock saddle slung on a triangular frame. {William King}started one of the first Sunday Schools in the country at Dursley Tabernacle in about 1775. {Captain Graham}lived in Rednock House, he imported the Irish wolf-hound from Ireland and bred them to stop the breed becoming extinct. {Edward Fox,}who was born in Dursley, helped negotiate the divorce of Henry 8th to Catherine of Arragon.
